conclusion: The transition from state D to state A is an isochoric (constant volume) process.
The diagram shows a vertical line from D to A, indicating constant volume.
During an isochoric process, the volume does not change, so the work done by the gas on the surroundings is zero.
Work done is given by the area under the P-V curve.
For a vertical line, the area under the P-V curve is zero.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is 0 Joules.
